snippet: The president opened the door to a lengthy, potentially contentious debate over the nature and extent of American engagement in Iraq and Syria.
abstract: Pres Obama says he will seek specific authorization from Congress for military campaign against Islamic State militants, opening door to lengthy, potentially contentious debate over nature and extent of American engagement in Iraq and Syria; announcement represents significant shift from Obama's earlier position that he had legal authority to take military action under existing statutes.

byline.original: By MARK LANDLER and DAVID E. SANGER

lead_paragraph: The president opened the door to a lengthy, potentially contentious debate over the nature and extent of American engagement in Iraq and Syria.

headline.main: Obama to Seek Congressional Backing for Military Campaign Against ISIS
headline.print_headline: Obama to Seek Congressional Backing for Campaign Against Islamic State

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
